key_points: Marine Cpl. Kelsee Lainhart was paralyzed in the Kabul Airport attack on Aug. 26.
Lainhart was involved in the withdrawal of U.S. troops and refugees during the final days of the U.S. involvement in Afghanistan.
Thirteen service members died in the Kabul Airport attack.
Since the attack, Lainhart has undergone two surgeries and remains hospitalized.
Her recovery journey has taken her from Walter Reed in Washington to Shirley Ryan AbilityLab in Chicago.
The Dearborn County community, where Lainhart is from, supported her through a T-shirt fundraiser organized by Sunman-Dearborn Community Schools.
Due to the volume of support messages, Lainhart's parents set up a P.O. box.
Lainhart expresses amazement and gratitude for the widespread support she has received.
She is considering a post-military career, depending on her recovery progress.
Despite her injuries, Lainhart does not regret her decision to join the Marines.
